forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain and patchy fog. Cloudy, with a low around 34. Southeast wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain and patchy fog. Cloudy, with a high near 63. South wind 7 to 29 mph, with gusts as high as 51 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock ticks past the witching hour, the quiet streets of Boston rest under a shroud of rain and patchy fog, a lingering blanket that cloaks the city’s charm in a muted embrace. The air is heavy, swollen with moisture, tapping gently against the windowpanes, hinting at the symphony of raindrops that will persist through the night. The temperature hovers near the cold end of the spectrum, urging you to layer up as you prepare for the day ahead. With a forecast promising persistent rain and gusty winds, it might be wise to opt for a sturdy umbrella and a waterproof jacket to ward off the chill and dampness.

As dawn approaches, the sky awakens with clouds, the rain intensifying into a steady downpour, yet a warmth lingers beneath the surface – a brief glimpse of the mercurial shift that will see temperatures rise throughout the day. This Wednesday holds the promise of dramatic winds that may dance mischievously along the streets, urging you to hold onto your hats while enveloping the city in a brisk embrace. While the mayhem of the weather may not beckon you to linger outdoors, it is an ideal time to find solace in a cozy café, sipping a warm brew and watching the world outside drench itself in the steady rhythm of the rain. Embrace the day’s imperfections; it offers a rare chance to slow down, to inhale the petrichor, and to read that book you’ve been meaning to delve into as the rain taps insistently against the window, a comforting reminder of the beauty of quiet moments.
